entities.description: Also known as 锔 Archangel Michael. Associated with "Who is like God?" (Hebrew: 执指值, Mikha'el), Commander of Heaven's armies, Protector of Israel and the Church, Defeater of Satan. Known as "Who is like God?" (Hebrew: 执指值. Symbolized by sword.
roles: Michael is associated with the end times and the Last Judgment. In some traditions, he is depicted holding the scales that weigh souls, determining their eternal destiny. He is also believed to sound the trumpet announcing the resurrection of the dead and Christ's Second Coming.

iconography:
arms: radiating like a sun, each hand bearing an eye in its palm,
                representing

     's ability to see and respond to suffering throughout all realms simultaneously

arms: symbolize his limitless capacity to help beings, while the eyes represent wisdom seeing the
                true nature of suffering

lotus: (padma), symbolizing purity and spiritual unfoldment
     


     Often depicted in the lalitasana posture
                (royal ease), with one leg extended and one folded, wearing princely ornaments and silk garments, crowned
                with an image of Amitabha Buddha
lotus: blossom, emphasizing accessibility and intimate connection with devotees

posture: (royal ease), with one leg extended and one folded, wearing princely ornaments and silk garments, crowned

entities.displayName: Manjushri (娈甯 / 嘟嘟嘟嗉嘟嘟嘟｀嘟嘟嗑编嘟嗉)
entities.title: Manjushri" - Buddhist Mythology
symbols: lion (representing fearlessness and the lion's roar of Dharma)
Om A Ra Pa Ca Na Dhih (啷 啶 啶 啶 啶 啶 啶о啶)
RA: Free from dust, purifying conceptual stains
Reciting texts of the Prajnaparamita cycle
epithets: Jampal Yang (嘟嘟嘟嗉嘟嘟嘟｀嘟嘟嗑编嘟嗉) - "Gentle Splendor
entities.description: Also known as Manjushri (娈甯 / 嘟嘟嘟嗉嘟嘟嘟｀嘟嘟嗑编嘟嗉). Associated with unknown. Known by the epithets: Manjushri.
sutra_references: His left hand holds a stem of an utpala lotus
iconography:
lotus: posture)
                or in lalitasana (royal ease), adorned with the
                ornaments of a bodhisattva: crown, earrings, necklaces, armlets, and flowing silk garments

lotus: (blue lotus) which supports the Prajnaparamita Sutra
                ("Perfection of Wisdom" text)

sword: of discriminating awareness that cuts through
                ignorance, delusion, and dualistic thinking, revealing the empty nature of all phenomena

sword: His right hand holds the flaming sword of discriminating wisdom (prajna khadga)
                raised high

vajra: Holding vajra and bell, representing the union of wisdom and method
     


       Dharmadhatu-Vagishvara
       
        Manjushri
       
       :
      
      Yellow, sitting in meditation, emphasizing wisdom-nature
     


       Arapacana
       
        Manjushri
       
       :
      
      Five syllables representing the five wisdoms
     


       Yamantaka:
      
      Wrathful form as "Slayer of the Lord of Death," defeating ignorance-as-death
     





       Primary Sources:
      
       Manjushri
      
      in Buddhist Texts
     

      
     



      Vimalakirti Sutra
     


       Vimalakirti Nirdesa Sutra:Chapter 3:The Disciples' Reluctance
      

       "
       
        The Buddha
       
       said to
       
        Manjushri
       
       : 'You go to Vimalakirti to inquire about his illness

vajra: body, speech, and mind of all Buddhas
     


       A:
      
      Unoriginated nature of all phenomena (primordial purity)
     


       RA:
      
      Free from dust, purifying conceptual stains
     


       PA:
      
      Beyond paramita, transcending ordinary perfections
     


       CA:
      
      No movement in
      
       samsara
      
      , beyond birth-death cycle
     


       NA:
      
      Nameless, beyond all designations
     


       DHIH:
      
      Seed syllable of
      
       Manjushri
      
      , representing prajna itself
     


     Meditation Practices
    




        Manjushri
       
       Sadhana:
      
      Visualization practice combined with mantra recitation to develop wisdom
     


       Analytical Meditation:
      
      Using logic and analysis to investigate the nature of self and phenomena
     


       Study Practice:
      
      Deep study of Prajnaparamita and Madhyamaka texts as spiritual practice
     


       Debate:
      
      Rigorous logical debate as a method to sharpen discriminating wisdom
     


     Devotional Practices
    


      Invoking
      
       Manjushri
      
      before study or teaching sessions
     

      Pilgrimage to mount_wutai in China
     

      Offering lights to represent dispelling darkness of ignorance
     

      Reciting texts of the Prajnaparamita cycle
     




     Related Figures
    



       Complementary Bodhisattvas
      


        Avalokiteshvara
       
       (compassion paired with
       
        Manjushri
       
       's wisdom)
      



       Power Complement
      

       vajrapani (power/method, forming the trinity of wisdom-compassion-power)
      



       Wrathful Form
      


        Yamantaka
       
       (Slayer of Death, wrathful wisdom destroying ego)
      



       Historical Emanations
      


        Nagarjuna
       
       ,
       
        Tsongkhapa
       
       ,
       
        Shantideva
       





    Story Themes
   


     Related Content
    



       Cross-Cultural Parallels
      



         Saraswati
        
        - Hindu goddess of wisdom and learning
       


         Athena
        
        - Greek goddess of wisdom
       


         Thoth
        
        - Egyptian god of knowledge and writing
       




       Related Archetypes
      



         The Sage
        
        - Wisdom keeper archetype
       


         The Scholar
        
        - Knowledge seeker archetype
       


         The Divine Teacher
        
        - Dharma transmission
       





      See Also
     



        Avalokiteshvara
       
       - Complementary Bodhisattva of Compassion
      


        Yamantaka
       
       - Wrathful form of Manjushri
      


        Nagarjuna
       
       - Historical emanation of Manjushri
      


        Tsongkhapa
       
       - Great scholar-saint and Manjushri emanation

entities.description: Also known as The 99 Beautiful Names (Asma al-Husna). Associated with All Creation, All Knowledge, All Power. Known by the epithets: Ar-Rahman (The Compassionate).

ninety_nine_names.meaning: The Trustee, The Disposer of Affairs

ninety_nine_names.arabic: 匕 丕噩丕 丕廿乇丕

divine_attributes:
- Tawhid


Essence
Absolute Unity (Tawhid)


Domains
All Creation, All Knowledge, All Power


Symbols
Crescent Moon, Star, Calligraphy


Sacred Text
Quran (revealed word)


Primary Names
Ar-Rahman (The Compassionate), Ar-Rahim (The Merciful)


Relationship
Creator-Creation, Master-Servant, Closer than jugular vein


The Nature of Allah

Tawhid (absolute monotheism) is the cornerstone of Islamic theology

All of Allah's attributes are perfect and without deficiency
Divine Will: Everything that occurs is by Allah's permission and decree (Qadr)
Mercy Above All: "My mercy encompasses all things" (Quran 7:156)


Verse of Pure Monotheism (Ayat al-Tawhid):
                "Say: He is Allah, the One
